documents.title: explained : bakewell tart vs pudding
text: pudding shop manager sammy bright explained the pudding is what the town is actually famous for .
it 's a puff pastry base with a layer of strawberry jam , a mixture of eggs , ground almonds , sugar , butter and a secret ingredient , which sets like an egg custard .
she said the tart is what most people know with its shortcrust pastry , jam and sponge filling but it actually originated in the us .

`` back in the day , my gran will tell you that you could n't get a tart apart from the supermarkets and the pudding shops only sold puddings in those days but due to demand we now sell both , '' she said .

documents.title: puddings and tarts on sale side-by-side in bakewell
text: not many visitors to bakewell we spoke to knew how different a bakewell pudding and tart were - and quite how controversial it can be .
things have softened a little in this corner of derbyshire over the years , with puddings and tarts on sale side-by-side .
for locals , however , the pudding still comes out on top .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: what 's the difference between bakewell 's puddings and tarts ?
text: anyone with a sweet tooth will be familiar with the joys of a famous , fruity bakewell tart - but go to derbyshire and you may be in for a shock .
in bakewell itself , it 's the town 's eponymous pudding they 're proud of , with the tart viewed with deep sus in some quarters .
so what 's the difference between the two ?
we went out to ask the tourists and townsfolk what they knew .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: council tax : savings still needed
text: despite tax going up , derby city council said it still needed to find £ 14m of savings over the next year .
it plans to achieve this by changing the way services are provided - so instead of getting help at home straight away you might get some gadgets and mobilty aids .
there 's also planned `` commercialisation '' of some services - which means either getting you to pay for it at the point of use or paying someone else to deliver the service .
finally there 's `` organisation and governance '' - basically back office stuff .
a lot of the costs there are staff costs - so we could see up to 100 jobs cut , probably achieved by what they call `` natural wastage '' - that 's not recruiting for vacant posts when people leave .
author: Wesley Mallin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: council tax : big rise to pay for social care
text: the 4.99 % council tax increase incorporates an extra 3 % to pay for adult social care .

the government 's given local authorities permission to add an extra 6 % to council tax over the next three years to meet this cost and derby city council wants to go for 3 % this year , another 3 % next year and no rise in the final year .
this contrasts with derbyshire county council which is doing it in three lots of 2 % .
author: Wesley Mallin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: derby facing 5 % council tax rise
text: a council tax rise of nearly 5 % is being proposed by derby city council .
it includes the 3 % the government says it needs to charge to meet the rising cost of social care .
author: Wesley Mallin
Political reporter, BBC Radio Derby
